verse.roman:
gacchan pathi mahā-bhāgo
bhagavaty ambujekṣaṇe
bhaktiṁ parām upagata
evam etad acintayat

synonyms: gacchan—traveling; pathi—along the road; mahā-bhāgaḥ—the greatly fortunate; bhagavati—for the Supreme Personality of Godhead; ambuja-īkṣaṇe—the lotus-eyed Lord; bhaktim—devotion; parām—exceptional; upagataḥ—he experienced; evam—thus; etat—this (as follows); acintayat—he thought.
translation: As he traveled on the road, the great soul Akrūra felt tremendous devotion for the lotus-eyed Personality of Godhead, and thus he began to consider as follows.
